07/02/2025 - Office Visit 
Provider: Abdallah S Farrukh MD 
Location of Care: Antelope Valley Neuroscience Medi cal Group 
History of Present Illness: 
Okay so the things am going to try to evaluate and find the etiology of her complaint she get this ele ctric 
discharges that goes from her neck all the way down  the arms on the leg and she is to have numbness in  
the calf before the surgery distill their so that e very now and then she gets this shocking electric d ischarge 
is electric discharges the last momentarily and the y can be from 2-4 times a day therefore than that t here 
all the time 
She remained with numbness in both hands test decom pression of the carpal tunnel
So patient says her neck pain in the left especiall y when she had surgery and the cyst was removed is 
9/10 when she takes her medication the pain can go down all the way to 1/10 for few hours until she ca n 
pain comes back and she takes pain 
Right so we will plan to do CT scan of the cervical  spine with and without contrast MRI of the cervica l 
spine with and without contrast we should also do s oft tissue so we will order an MRI of the cervical spine 
with the neck with and without contrast so we can l ook at the soft tissue deceived there is any eviden ce of 
lymphadenopathy especially that she had had neck su rgery as well and the pain at the neck of the thigh  
from the below the ear all the way to the shoulder to there is no question the patient right lateral r otation is 
almost forward left cogitation painful limited only  to 10° PFF otherwise mentation is clear she is awa ke 
alert oriented ×3 pupils are equal and reactive the re is no limitation of upgaze no demeaning nystagmu s 
patient did well with upper appendicular cerebellar  activity muscle tone upper extremity within normal  limits 
muscle tone lower extremity within normal limits th ere is no long tract signs 
Patient does not report any ill effect from the int ake medication it has a very substantial improvemen t in 
her neck pain and a refill her medication for 
Active Medications: 
pregabalin 50 mg capsule (pregabalin) Take 1 capsul e by mouth three times a day as directed 
oxycodone-acetaminophen 5 mg-325 mg tablet (oxycodo ne-acetaminophen) Take 1 tablet by mouth every 
eight hours as needed for pain 
Topamax 25 mg tablet (topiramate) Take 1 tablet by mouth as directed WEEK 1 TAKE 1 TABLET 
AMWEEK 2 TAKE 1 TABLET AM AND 1 TABLET PMWEEK 3 TAK E 2 TABLETS AM AND 1 TABLET 
PMWEEK 4 AND SO ON TAKE 2 TABLETS AM AND 2 TABLETS PM 
methocarbamol 500 mg tablet (methocarbamol) Take 1 tablet by mouth every eight hours as directed for 
spasms 
Voltaren Arthritis Pain 1% gel (diclofenac sodium) Apply 2 gram to affected area once a day as directe d 
apply topically 2 grams  to shoulders once a day fo r 6 days, stop for 6 days and then continue regimen  for 
another 6 days 
Current Allergies: 
No known allergies
